column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Ms.
#Text=Power (United States of America): On\r
#Text=behalf of the United States, I should like sincerely\r
#Text=to thank those countries that voted in favour of\r
#Text=resolution 2272 (2016), which was adopted today.
#Text=The resolution underscores the Security Council's\r
#Text=responsibility - our responsibility - to address the\r
#Text=scourge of sexual exploitation and abuse in United\r
#Text=Nations peacekeeping, which has been allowed to\r
#Text=persist for far too long.
#Text=Impunity for such abuses clearly\r
#Text=undermines our efforts to promote international peace\r
#Text=and security.
#Text=The resolution makes clear that it is our\r
#Text=job to ensure that there is accountability when men,\r
#Text=women and children are abused by the Blue Helmets\r
#Text=whom the Council has sent to protect them.
#Text=The resolution signals the Security Council's strong\r
#Text=support for the zero-tolerance policy of the United\r
#Text=Nations and for the ongoing efforts by the Secretary-\r
#Text=General to strengthen this institution's response,\r
#Text=reporting and remedial measures to prevent and combat\r
#Text=sexual exploitation and abuse among United Nations\r
#Text=peacekeepers.
#Text=The resolution underscores the fact that\r
#Text=peacekeepers found guilty - not those accused, those\r
#Text=found guilty - of committing sexual exploitation\r
#Text=and abuse do not deserve to serve in United Nations\r
#Text=peacekeeping missions, and sends a clear message to\r
#Text=troop- and police-contributing countries that fail to\r
#Text=take action to prevent or punish credible allegations of\r
#Text=sexual abuse and exploitation, as well as to all States\r
#Text=Members of the United Nations and to United Nations\r
#Text=bodies, to ensure that these investigations are carried\r
#Text=out thoroughly, promptly and impartially.
#Text=I should also like to echo my French colleague's\r
#Text=comment that the colour of the helmet means little to\r
#Text=the victim.
#Text=All of us, wherever we serve, whether we\r
#Text=wear a blue or a green or some other colour helmet,\r
#Text=have a responsibility to live up to the standards that\r
#Text=this resolution tries to enshrine.
#Text=All of us have a\r
#Text=responsibility with respect to individuals who serve us\r
#Text=overseas, in the same way that we have a responsibility\r
#Text=within our own borders to ensure that these kinds of\r
#Text=crimes are never carried out and that when they are\r
#Text=carried out the perpetrators are held accountable.
#Text=The resolution adopted today endorses the decision\r
#Text=of the Secretary-General to repatriate United Nations\r
#Text=peacekeeping units that demonstrate widespread or\r
#Text=systemic sexual abuse and exploitation, and it requests\r
#Text=that the Secretary-General repatriate all uniformed\r
#Text=personnel from a contributing country in a given\r
#Text=mission if that country fails to take appropriate steps\r
#Text=to address credible allegations of sexual exploitation\r
#Text=and abuse, fails to hold the perpetrators accountable or\r
#Text=fails to inform the Secretary-General of the status of\r
#Text=such efforts.
#Text=I should like, if I could, to respond to Egypt's\r
#Text=intervention.
#Text=We were accused, implicitly, politely, of\r
#Text=having an ulterior motive.
#Text=I confess that I do have an\r
#Text=ulterior motive.
#Text=My ulterior motive is actually, finally,\r
#Text=to do something about a cancer: the cancer of sexual\r
#Text=exploitation and abuse against people who trust the\r
#Text=United Nations flag.
#Text=They see a peacekeeper coming\r
#Text=their way and they think, this is someone who is going\r
#Text=to help me; they do not think, I have to run, this is\r
#Text=someone who is going to rape me.
#Text=That is not what they\r
#Text=think.
#Text=That is not what they should ever think; but that\r
#Text=is what they are going to think, and that is with some of\r
#Text=them do think, because there is not accountability for\r
#Text=the crimes committed that is in any way commensurate\r
#Text=with what appears to be the scale of this problem.
#Text=So that is my ulterior motive, I confess.
#Text=Sue me.
#Text=I also take note of the very important comment that\r
#Text=Egypt made, of the admission that the measures\r
#Text=contained in the resolution - measures requiring\r
#Text=accountability - would not have been passed by the\r
#Text=General Assembly.
#Text=We agree; the General Assembly\r
#Text=has been totally paralysed.
#Text=There are countries within\r
#Text=the negotiations that are going on as we speak that\r
#Text=have tried to water down the recommendations that\r
#Text=the Secretary-General has made.
#Text=It would be one thing\r
#Text=if we were succeeding, if the system was working.
#Text=We come in here every day; we lament, we condemn.
#Text=We condemn the abuse and we condemn the lack of\r
#Text=accountability, and then we go to the General Assembly\r
#Text=and some of us try to water down provisions to try\r
#Text=to strengthen the system.
#Text=What is up with that?
#Text=One\r
#Text=cannot simultaneously try to water something down\r
#Text=in the General Assembly and then complain when\r
#Text=the body that sends peacekeepers out to try to protect\r
#Text=people actually takes responsibility for the fact that\r
#Text=some of those who were supposed to do the protecting\r
#Text=are committing sexual abuse.
#Text=We cannot have it both\r
#Text=ways.
#Text=If the General Assembly had been able to actually\r
#Text=put in place methods for accountability, if the system\r
#Text=were working for girls like the ones Matthew just\r
#Text=quoted, who are now left with the children of the people\r
#Text=who have come and raped them and then gone back to\r
#Text=their countries never having been held accountable - if\r
#Text=the system had prevented these kinds of acts, or least\r
#Text=had some kind of accountability, we would not be\r
#Text=having this conversation.
#Text=We are here only because it\r
#Text=just keeps happening.
#Text=So I think that it is very, very strange to hear\r
#Text=Member States call on the one hand for more aggressive\r
#Text=action or more accountability and then try to punt the\r
#Text=issue to a body that for years has been unable to come to\r
#Text=a consensus; and with several countries, again including\r
#Text=countries on the Council, trying to water down what\r
#Text=happens in the General Assembly, no reasonable person\r
#Text=could expect a different result.
#Text=Let me conclude with two messages.
#Text=To the tens of\r
#Text=thousands of troops and police who serve honourably\r
#Text=in United Nations peacekeeping operations, we salute\r
#Text=them unequivocally for putting their lives on the line,\r
#Text=with little fanfare or recognition, for people who live in\r
#Text=countries far from their own.
#Text=We and the civilians that\r
#Text=they protect with their bravery are completely indebted\r
#Text=to them for their service.
#Text=As I did yesterday (see S/PV.7642), I would single out those members of the\r
#Text=Council that have contributed so many peacekeepers,\r
#Text=including Egypt, Senegal, China, Uruguay and, of\r
#Text=course, the United Kingdom, which is becoming\r
#Text=involved again.
#Text=As a country that does not contribute\r
#Text=a lot of troops, we are in awe of their service.
#Text=To the\r
#Text=victims of sexual exploitation and abuse by United\r
#Text=Nations peacekeepers, we pledge that we will do better.
#Text=We will do better to ensure that the Blue Helmets we\r
#Text=send as their protectors will not become perpetrators.
#Text=That is what we are striving for.
#Text=But if they do, this\r
#Text=resolution demands that we, the Council, ensure that\r
#Text=the people who commit such violations, who violate the\r
#Text=good name of the United Nations and the good names of\r
#Text=their countries, be held accountable.
